website_summaries.verdict: For light polishing and sanding, it tops similarly sized models due to its 5-speed selection, quiet operation, and fairly reliable Lithium ion battery. But it isn’t for heavy-duty projects; the tool shuts off with only moderate torque.
pros: Front-end LED lighting, speed indicator, and battery-life gauge
Runs fairly quietly except at highest speed
Users are relatively happy w/manufacturer's replace/return policy
cons: Battery loses staying power over time
The tool shuts off with moderate torque
Oscillation, noise, and rattling are issues at highest speed

customer_reviews.title: Nail time is fun
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful dremel. Using for Great Dane nail trims. Love the lighted end and the power. Quieter and less vibration than the 7300 I had been using for years. Actually enjoy nail time now and so do my dogs (counter conditioning and desensitizing makes a huge difference too). Only thing I don't like is that it defaults to the middle speed setting when you turn it off. Would like it to stay at the last used setting.
customer_reviews.author: Cmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Love this awesome little dremel!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. I highly suggest grabbing one. It's powerful, lasts a long time, and is quiet, or quieter cpmpared to most other dremels. I currently have a corded 300 model (can't remember actual model atm) and this little feel is just as powerful on half the rotations. I am a groomers assistant and I can use this all day or small to large dog's nails. The bright led light is a massive plus and the fact that it auromatically stops if hair gets caught is awesome. I will actually get another one for home when I do artwork in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Necrolytesoul

customer_reviews.title: Love the lightness. Hate the battery life
customer_reviews.text: Batteries don't last very long and charging is very finicky. You have to keep adjusting in order to keep it charging.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie

customer_reviews.title: Great Dremel but won't charge after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: After heavy use in our pet grooming salon for a few weeks, it became difficult to get it to charge. We have to prop something behind it just right to get it to charge. We have tried 5 of these and all of them have done this. Otherwise it works well. I just buy the extended warranty and exchange them when it starts happening. It's annoying though
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this at the recommendation of a groomer friend of mine to use on my dog's toenails. I have been using a similar product for years that was specifically marketed for animals but this product is far superior. I really like the adjustable speed level which I can adjust for each dog's toenail size and length. This unit also has a backlight which is amazing! It came with a number of accessories and bands. I am very pleased and will be getting rid of my old grinder for good.
customer_reviews.author: T. BlackTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS BEFORE YOU WASTE YOUR MONEY AND TIME
customer_reviews.text: DISAPPOINTED IT HAD NO TORQUE. ZERO TORQUE. It can use a cutoff wheel to cut a toothpick but nothing like deep engraving. It you are trying to scratch glass or trim toenails maybe. But it is worthless. I have been using dremels for 35 years ALWYS HAPPY. WHEN I SAW THIS I WAS EXCITED. Now just like I do not believe this was even brought to market. If this were an iPad it would be a Polaroid sold at big lots. BAD
customer_reviews.author: LOVE TO READ

customer_reviews.title: Good but had to send first back
customer_reviews.text: I had some problems with the first one I orderd and will be sending back. Even so I ordered 2 more so not to be without one while I send it back. The charger was not working well. The Light is very useful. I have the other lithium battery ones also which work better but do not have the light. I have probably ordered over 20 dremels over the years. I hope they improve on this one but as is it is really good
customer_reviews.author: Doc Tim

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 2 days of use...
customer_reviews.text: My dremel Micro worked for a total of 2 days (as a groomer for nail trims) before the lock button popped and started to rattle. I'm shipping it back to Dremel today for warranty work...which will cost me another $10 out of pocket. I'm insanely bummed because when it did work, it was great. Sadly, I will be going back to using my $25 tool from Harbor Freight (1yr old) that has yet to break on me. Poor quality, Dremel!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight cordless wonder!
customer_reviews.text: Great for crafts. I use for drilling/buffing/finishing polymer clay and jewelry pieces. I like that the charger is smart-stops charging once battery is full to prolong the battery life. I looked at a jooltool and decided this would be better for me. I made my own sanding discs with Velcro, craft foam, and a screw mandrel. 3m makes radial polishing brushes for the jool tool hand piece (in a flex shaft) that will work with this dremel 8050 micro and the multipro keyless chuck. I use pumice (600grit), then 6 micron, 1micron, buffing wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, not durable
customer_reviews.text: Not durable at all, purchased two and the first one died within a month of usage, got it replaced under warranty then both failed withing 6 month of usage. They won't hold a charge, and won't turn on, don't recommend them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: 2 & 1/2 months and it died
customer_reviews.text: was working great! loved it, but two and a half months to the day (literally!), I'm in the middle of a job, and i turn to grab it and there are no lights on it, it won't turn on. and when i drop it into the charger nothing happens. WTF!? i initiate a chat to see if anyone at amazon would be willing to help, no dice. a very cold, "after 30 days FU-call the manufacturer, heres a link to GFY. Thanks for selling me junk amazon!
customer_reviews.author: JK57

customer_reviews.title: I loved it at first but after a couple months of ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved it at first but after a couple months of use (I’m a groomer) it would not turn on. I left it alone for about a week and was able to get it to charge again and turn on after two days of it working again would randomly turn on and off then had an awful chemical burning smell and I finally threw it away. * when it first stopped working I contacted Dremel and they informed me I could send it back and they would send me another but when the sent me the box to return it they would not give me any shipping labels and stopped responding to emails
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Stops holding charge after 2 months. Save your money
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE! Bought in July and it's only sept and already stopped holding a charge. Fully charged it dies after using it one time. You would think with how much you spend it would last a whole lot longer!! I'm a dog bather and this is absolutely perfect for nail grinding! The longest I've done without charging is 2 days but I'm sure it could last longer I will test it out soon to see how long with a full charge. Price is definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: eric rendon

customer_reviews.title: Stops at the slightest pressure
customer_reviews.text: I used to have one of these which I misplaced. I just bought a new one to replace it because I liked it very much. The new one shuts off constantly with the slightest pressure on the cutting wheel. This one is going back. What a shame
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have had my 8050 Dremel for about one hour ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had my 8050 Dremel for about one hour. I began charging it. I took it off the charger and filed one of my dog's nails. I put it back on the charger. Twenty or so minutes later, I noticed that the charging lights weren't on. I tried to turn on the Dremel again. Nothing. It won't charge; it won't run, even though it had sufficient charge to do so. I bought this model because the 7300s that my grooming salon purchases always turn to sh** within a month or so, and I was really hoping that this would last. Ha.
customer_reviews.author: M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to finally open up my dremel to use on my project. It worked for about 5 minutes and the battery started to die. I plugged it in to charge it. 30 minutes later it was completely dead and will not charge or turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Delores Williamson

customer_reviews.title: could be a much better product if made with ion battery
customer_reviews.text: A ton of dog groomers use this tool, however my first one died after a ur, will not recharge, due to battery is NOT a lithium ion, which means everytime you put it in the charging dock it retains memory, and after time it just won't charge. Plus half the time its touchy in charging dock, could be a much better product if made with ion battery.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle mcgowan

customer_reviews.title: 5 star if it were not for flimsy fit in charging base
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a heavier duty nail grinder for my grooming area. I like that I can change the speed. it is quieter than most, so some dogs don't freak at the noise. I just find the recharging base a bit flimsy to use. The recharging elements don't sit tightly enough and sometimes I come in and find it is not recharged completely. I've taken to taping it in place. It' is the only reason it is not a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Button placement and shape not ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Button placement not consistent with how I use it for coping molding. I use a coping saw to rough cut my molding, and use this to get shave things down to a 1/32 of a inch. It's too thick to hold like a pen, so I hold it like a paring knife. The LEDs shine in my eyes so I had to block them with masking tape (there's no on/off). The locking button (for changing bits) sometimes gets pushed when I'm holding it, and it's inconvenient to increase the speed while I'm using it since the speed buttons are on the other end. Otherwise it's very useful...
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: I also like that it has a light feature which helps me ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to dremel 2 dogs' nails (vizslas). The motor seems strong enough to do the job. I also like that it has a light feature which helps me out. The dogs really don't like to get dremeled any higher than the second lowest level and that seems to have enough power to grind their nails. They would prefer on the lowest level, but that doesn't really have enough power -- if you press too hard, it will actually stop the Dremel! So far, the motor is going strong. For reference, I dremel their nails 1-2x/week and have had this for one year.
customer_reviews.author: Reader and

customer_reviews.title: battery never charged, not even once
customer_reviews.text: total garbage, the battery would never charge and I bought it brand new on amazon, must just be a defective model...i'll try the newer 8220 with the lithium battery instead I guess....why would they sell something that doesn't even work?
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Great for Groomers!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but excellent things to say about this dremel! I am a dog groomer and I have use the removable battery dremels in the past for grinding nails. With the frequency I used it I was replacing my battery dremel just about yearly. This rechargeable stand dremel is amazing! I love the 5 choices of speed because you can set it low for the very nervous dogs and high for the dogs who are unfazed. At first I thought the light on top would be excessive but after having used it for a few months I wouldn't go back to an unlit one. It really helps to see where the quick in the nail is.
customer_reviews.author: Elynn H.

customer_reviews.title: Keyless Chuck Lock Button
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. However the raised black 'lock button' on the chuck, is right next to the power button. I often slide by it to hit the off button; and the 'lock button' gets slightly depressed, and grinds inside on the chuck. After about 3 times of accidental grazings, I heard a plastic tooth break off. Now it is loose and rattles freely. This needs to be re-designed with a stronger spring, and I need to replace the button somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Dremel ever!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used dremel for years in my grooming business and various other home tasks, owning well over 10 of them. This by far is my favorite cordless one. No more battery releasing accidentally because the side clips are stretched from daily use. No more searching for replacement battery. Ugh. That was the worst. Variable speed is so helpful for puppies all the way to Great Danes. It is lightweight and very balanced in hand making the task so much wasier. Bonus light for these aging eyes! The battery lasts me for couple days easily with regular usage and indicates it’s getting low yet it still has enough power to finish the job.
customer_reviews.author: Kcanbeamusing

customer_reviews.title: the battery life has been great. I can go a couple weeks without needing ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this Dremel to give my dogs nail trims. It works very well for this purpose and is quieter than the Dremel 4.8 Pet Grooming tool. The light helps so much since I'm often filing down their nails in the evenings. One of my dogs is a shiba inu and the other is a GSD mix. I work on their nails multiple times a week. So far, the battery life has been great. I can go a couple weeks without needing to recharge although I usually charge it once a week. If you're looking for a Dremel for dog nails, this one is a great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Celine D. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Not even a year old won't take a charge.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to trim my dog's nails. It's not a year old yet and won't take a charge. Contacting customer service it's says two year warranty. I will let you know what happens.
customer_reviews.author: ML333

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: When the shipping box arrived, I opened the box and noticed that the package had been previously opened and then resealed with tape; strange. I went ahead and opened it and sure enough, the package contained the dremel tool but not charger, base station, instructions or other packaging. I immediately requested a return label and took it to the UPS drop point. Very disappointed. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Micheline Devaurs

customer_reviews.title: Pet Toenail Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help trim the toenails of our dogs. Yes, this Dremel can be kind of loud at higher speeds. But, I took the time to get the dogs used to it turned off first, and then turned on at different speeds. Our Golden Retriever wasn't too worked up about it at any point. Our Lab mix, who was a rescue, took a little bit to get used to it, but now she has no issues. It works great for sanding down their toenails, and the light in the end of the Dremel is awesome. I highly recommend this item for trimming dog toenails, and watching some good tutorials online before attempting it yourself at home.
customer_reviews.author: J. Simonds

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: I use this to grind down my dogs tough toe nails. They don't seem to mind it at all. Don't hold it onto the nail for more than 5 seconds at a time because the nail could heat some. But it's a great tool to dremel the nails. It has a light as well which helps. Holds a good charge in the battery too.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary1001

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rechargeable drill for several reasons. Not only for my jewelry projects, I use it to trim our dogs claws (on low, they don't mind it as much, higher settings scare them) but I also use it on my husband's thick toenails so he can have normal looking toenails thickened by nail fungus (saw a Youtube video on how to use it). It holds a charge for a very long time, it has a light so you can see what you are doing at the end of the drill, has several tool ends. I've always wanted one and looked a long time at the stores before ordering here.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to etch my mirrors. For many years, I used acid instead of a dremel. I bought in August and didn’t use it until about mid-March (covid boredom) I used it to complete two small mirrors. And now it won’t even work. Won’t charge. Won’t turn on. It’s completely dead. I noticed that it took 3 1/2 hours to charge, and I only got a half hour use out of it. This is NOT a product you want to buy. I’ve always been told that dremel is the best out there. They need to take this product off the market. Too many people with bad reviews.
customer_reviews.author: amy christensen

customer_reviews.title: Run Away Tool
customer_reviews.text: Tool was sitting in the charger, unplugged the charger to move it, and the tool came on by itself in the wide open speed. None of the buttons would work, couldn't turn it off, there was a small cut off wheel on it so I couldn't set it down. The tool started getting hot and then started smoking. ( Bad Smell). I bogged down the wheel to stop it, lock it down and remove the cut off wheel. Battery died , hasn't worked since. Tool seen little use, was brand new. Wife used it to manicure nails. If this didn't happen, I really liked the tool, even bought an additional set of bits for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lalla

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy this sooner?!
customer_reviews.text: I have used an older model for over 15 years and my new dog was terrified of it so I decided to get this newer model with the LED lights. I cannot believe how much "quieter" it is compared to my dinosaur model. It is so much lighter and easier for my small hands to hold. The LED lights are nice to have but I still use a LED headlight for better visibility especially while grinding down dark dog nails. My new dog is still scared of the new dremel, however, she does tolerate it much better than my older model. My husband and I love this model!
customer_reviews.author: Lilti9er

customer_reviews.title: Great new tool for dog manicures!
customer_reviews.text: Wife had an old pistol grip style dremel (see pic). It was about ten years old and is quite loud. It is only used for grooming our dogs nails. She wanted a quieter option. This new dremel is much quieter and it has the led lights that help too. She did both dogs nails the first day this came. She is very happy with the upgrade. Awesome option for doggie manicures!
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: What's happening Dremel?
customer_reviews.text: I had used the same Micro Dremel for 8 years and then my grooming shop caught fire and burnt to the ground. I bought my second one thinking it would be just as great, but I was left with a bad taste in my mouth.....could it be all the toenails I'd been inhaling? Nope...it was the Dremel. I thought, maybe i just got a lemon, so I ordered a new one and this one is just as bad. The motor sounds like it's going to explode or something which does NOT calm my dog;s nerves when they're about to get their nails trimmed. Please, please figure out what is happening? I want my first dremel micro back!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly J. Mayo

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the one for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have a jewelry business and I have needed a good and comfortable rotary tool to finish my works. I had a bunch of rotary tools in the last years and they all failed me. Now I can finally say this is the one! It is great tool, it’s not loud at all but still strong and does the job perfectly, the possibility to charge it and not to be limited by cable is great and I’m absolutely looove ❤️❤️❤️ the light in the head of it that halps me to see the little details.
customer_reviews.author: Linoy Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Its useless if it cant be charged
customer_reviews.text: I used it once, worked marvelously. Problem is I put it back to charge and it didnt work. Its useless if it cant be charged.
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Charger Blows
customer_reviews.text: This is the second dremel tool I have purchased in 2019. The first one the battery would not hold a charge after a few months so I figured these things sometimes happen....second purchased August of 2019 and already the charger is not working. Love the tool when it works but they do not last long.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Small tool for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot rate battery life as I have not run it down yet. It is not a full sized Dremel tool so I won't try to say it doesn't work as well as a full sized Dremel. I bought it to do some power carving. In something soft like basswood, it does well. I have also used it to polish brass, aluminum, and a bit of stainless steel. It works well for small tasks.
customer_reviews.author: RockledgeWoodDog

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, boxers don't mind it at all  Just make sure to desensitize them before actually using it on their nails to grind
customer_reviews.text: We use this dremel with a diamageove grinding bit on our boxers nails. Works great! Doesn't get hot, its quiet and the dogs don't mind it at all. I started off slowly getting them used to it. I turned it on low, placed the butt of the dremel on my hand while my hand was on their body, i then moved to their feet and used the butt on their nails (no grinding, just letting them feel the vibration) I would then just briefly touch their nail and treat them. They now do not mind it at all and will sleep through the grinding most of the time now
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Finally . . . major improvements from Dremel
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to maneuver than the larger and corded models. Someone should get a big gold star for coming up with the idea of putting four LEDs next to the bit. Huge fan of the battery since it isn't one of those irritating NiCads. Finally, some designers at Dremel are thinking outside of the box. I've been waiting for years for a rotary tool with lithium ion battery . . . and here it is.
customer_reviews.author: john robison

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool for a multitude of uses!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this specifically to file my dogs nails. I have German Shepherds and this cordless tool is PERFECT! The light at the tip illuminates the work area perfectly. The variable speed enables me to soften the sound of the tool to suite more fearful dogs. The battery lasts many uses and the recharging dock is small and convenient. I love that all of the accessories come it a little storage case. Great tool can’t wait to find other uses!
customer_reviews.author: Chrisitne M

customer_reviews.title: I will never own another dremel!
customer_reviews.text: As a dog groomer, I've tried several other brands of dremels. I've shied away from cordless ones because the battery life usually sucks. However, I am beyond impressed. I love the light to help me see the nails better so I don't run into the dog's kwiks and I love that I can leave it off the charger for the entire week without worrying about it dying on me.
customer_reviews.author: Meridith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for use when regular drill is too bulky.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a corded Dremel for over 50 Years. They are high quality and last a long time. They are perfect for model making and other crafts where a small, light weight tool is needed for accuracy. It is also useful for sharpening garden cutting tools, axes, etc. The cordless model is especially handy for a quick fix and an electric plug is not near (like outside). Highly recommend the cordless Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Dog nails
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional dog groomer. I use this dremel to do dog nails. I had the Dremel 7700 for 2 years before it broke. It was a great Dremel for nail grinding. I wanted a better dremel because the 7700 isn't perfect. Pros: light weight, strong, fits well in my hand, built in battery, hads stand charger with long cord. Cons: light is inconvenient for doing dogs nails, the speed resets when you turn it off, it's a little louder than the 7700.
customer_reviews.author: Haylee

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned out after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: Product stopped working after 3 times using it. It was working fine after the first two times. Heck, great even! Then nothing. I even gave the little motor a boost to get it started. I was hoping it needed a little inspiration or some help to get going, but the battery meter started flashing. I took this as a last gasp from the monitor. It was trying to communicate it was in duress. I finally decided to let it go on May 1, 2020. I purchased a new Dremel Lite to fill this Micro’s void in our household. THe Dremel Lite is doing alright, but it can sense the spiritual presence of its predecessor, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Variable speed, maneuverability, easy to handle, quiet on lower speeds, yet efficient to nail shaping. My "bull" nail is gone. Quick & easy. Works great on the dogs too, with no loud stressful noise. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: TJAustin

customer_reviews.title: Nice but mine rattles noise if on above low speed, but quiter than my other plug in model, great for dog nails, price on cyber
customer_reviews.text: I own dremels for 20 plus years, this one nice but little disappointed seems to rattle inside when above low speed but stops if I hold press it together so too many cheap plastic loose parts inside, if it did not rattle ti would be 5 star and it is quieter than my plug in one, stronger than the pet one. but it works really nice. This one I got for dog nails and was the one that was recommended for Whitman's Diamagroove Pinnacle (that expensive but worth the money on doing dogs nails ). But at the cyber monday price of 69.99 free shipping and kit of 18 tools price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I can use it for pretty much anything I'm working on and as long as I have the bits to do so. It's ok to hold although with what I use it for I might consider getting some kind of apparatus that holds it in place or something. Battery life isn't the best. I find that I often have to charge after like an hour or 2 I would chalk it up to either the battery not getting full charged possibly.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos J. Roldan

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: great product. comes with some accessories. originally purchased to dremel my puppy's nails. he will not have anything to do with that, but not the products fault. We decided to keep it and use around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Went back to the corded model but dogs hate the noise
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Dremel for our dogs toenails. Went back to the corded model but dogs hate the noise. As I am getting older, I LOVE the lighted wheel on this. So much easier, faster and less stressful for me and the pups. Only used once and the results are great. Very efficient. Love the 2 year warranty. So far so good!!
customer_reviews.author: Bittersweetgsp

customer_reviews.title: Multi-functional tool, easy to use, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Warning... purchasing this product can lead to obsessing over what each accessory can do and the infinite creative and functional opportunities it brings. It’s a superhero tool. I got it for carving wood signs but have used it to do so much more. It’s easy to hold and control (my hands are small). The variable speeds are really helpful. It’s cordkess and holds a charge for a long time. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas, I put it on the charger overnight, and the next day it still was not working. I started reading online about this product and found the problem to be very common with this cordless product. Luckily I bought it through Amazon and they took it back no questions asked. I bought her a different dremmel with a cord and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: wayne Winterton

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it...you will be glad you did
customer_reviews.text: Ideal size for polishing watches, bands, pretty much anything. Comes with a variety of stuff to get you started. Just go and buy a big kit with everything and you can save your money. It is rechargeable and not bulky. I love mine. Just be careful polishing your watch. Don't slip and scratch your case.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D. Redfield

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Although my dogs hate the sound of it and are quite scared by it, Dremmel does a great job filing down their nails and I don't have to worry about damaging their quick. It also leaves nice an smooth ends oppose to sharp ones after clipping. If you want to save money and do it yourself, this is the product. I use it on GSD and Cocker Spaniel.
customer_reviews.author: Una

customer_reviews.title: Not as effective as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I got this in hopes to go with my super expensive diamond bit. They recommend it. But it isn’t what I hoped for. It’s not that powerful and is definitely not as effective as I’d like it to be. It’s so LOUD it scares my puppies. I was hoping for this to be great I’ll take it as a travel one but this one isn’t the one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Qasim Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: WOW, this thing is amazing! I had gotten an Andis pet nail trimmer but it was sooo weak and slow! THIS is what we needed... thanks! As other reviewers mentioned, it is fast, powerful, and smooth/quiet. My dog who is afraid of loud noises and other mechanical things didn't mind at all, and got a treat after. Still plenty of power left over, too! Highly recommended! :)
customer_reviews.author: LJC

customer_reviews.title: Womp womp woooomp
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool for dog nails.... As many other people use this for. I kept buying the 7700 series but one dog kick and it breaks. So I quit wasting $40 every 6mons and just get a bettet made one. $73 in 12/19 we are now 3/4 and this dremel just stopped working!!! Didn't even hit the floor, knocked around nothing. The base charges the device does nothing! Not even on another base. I am sooooo mad I can't return it. This tool IS a vital tool for my work. And I don't have the time to send it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, comfortable, precise, and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this item. It exceeded my expectations, and allows fine control in etching tasks.
customer_reviews.author: clanmackay

customer_reviews.title: Quit after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I use this specially for dremeling dogs nails at work. It has a few speeds which is great so the scared dogs I can go slower, but can also speed it up for those big thick nails like basset hounds. It's a bit long but it's light weight and I prefer it over all the others I've had. So I updated this review as I've only had this less then 3 months and it quite working completely. Sad day.
customer_reviews.author: Af

customer_reviews.title: great rotary tool that works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool and much more convenient that my dremel or rotozip that require them to be plugged in to operate. This charges quickly, is always ready to go, and has plenty of power for most jobs. It takes any dremel tip just like a corded dremel and tightens easily and stays tight. Speed is adjustable and it easily fits in your hand to make working with it a charm. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these and both have died within 6 months because of battery issues. you can go to walmart and get a generic one for 25$ that will last just as long. its better to buy the the 7300, and it will last you at least a year, and if you have any battery problems you at least be able buy another battery, instead of buying a whole new grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Andari

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog nail grooming
customer_reviews.text: I got these after the recommendation from a dog groomer who uses this one professionally. I carefully grind down the nail just a little at a time instead of clipping them off, he likes it better too. Sometimes when pressing harder the dermal will stop, not sure if this is a safety feature, but I just have to press the power button for it to come on again. For other, not dog nails, products this might be a little annoying if it happens often enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work as a Vet Tech & just love this product for filing pups nails - bought one ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow - just wow! Work as a Vet Tech & just love this product for filing pups nails - bought one for myself when doing my "community service" in the neighborhood and filing my neighbor's dog's nails. Very ergonomical, easy to use (with power settings) and a helpful light... couldn't ask for more!
customer_reviews.author: Dhdoodle

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with item
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my dermal about a month ago to work on my gourd projects and it has quit working already. The charger is ok but the tool will not turn on. What can I do? Can u help me? Susan English. 614-767-9557 Ohlawgirl@gmail.com or ohlawgirl@yahoo.com
customer_reviews.author: Susan J. English

customer_reviews.title: Bought for dog nails, but using for many projects
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to smooth dog nails after clipping, and it's perfect for that. Also very useful for regular projects that you would use any Dremel tool for. I already have a corded one for heavy duty use, but this micro cordless tool is great for a quick hit on something without breaking out the extension cord. Easy to hold and control the speed.
customer_reviews.author: ememen

customer_reviews.title: One happy groomer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for dog nails as I'm a pet groomer, and I love it!! Now I've only had it for a week ago I can't say how long it will last but to not have to worry about a charges battery or the battery dying as soon as you start or even just the plain hassle of storing chargers and extra batteries is amazing. It's very light weight and slender which makes it very easy to handle. Plus all the speed settings make it perfect for any size dog. I am one happy groomer.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlynn Danforth

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs nails, much better than clippers
customer_reviews.text: This has been a game changer for me! Trimming my dogs nails used to be a huge dramatic ordeal, and she would squirm and fight me the whole time. With this Dremel she sits there and stays calm while I quickly get them done—it takes about half the time it did with traditional clippers, and I am a lot less worried about accidentally getting the quick. I’ve been able to keep her nails shorter. I use the lowest setting or the second lowest and it is very quiet. The light is helpful as well. Battery life is pretty long. Very happy with this purchase, and I’m probably never going back to regular pet clippers ever again!
customer_reviews.author: emacke

customer_reviews.title: Small and Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned three other Dremel tools. This one is much quieter. It is small enough to wield like a pencil in between your finger tips. It has five speeds. On the lowest speed, which is the one I love to use on my small projects, you can hardly hear it at all! I also found some very fine bits which are excellent for the detail work I do when hand carving small chess men. I still have other Dremel tools but this one is now my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: jim coward

customer_reviews.title: Great rotary tool
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it to cut aluminum and steel for my robotics team. It lasts a fair amount of time of continuous use before needing to be recharged (about 12-15 minutes). The higher RPM that you set it to, the less time you have of course. The only downside is that the tool is very loud on the highest RPM. Overall, I like that it's portable so I can take it to my robotics competitions to make minor adjustments. The lightweight size of the model enables my team to make cuts in comfortable positions.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: anyone else have their's just stop working
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten two of theses the first one I got stopped turning on after two days the second one i got to replace it just recently stopped turning ,which sucks because I need it for work i use it for to grind stuff down and make it smooth and etc and because I already got a replacement for I can't get another replacement without just buy a new one so im going to be buying a different type a dermal since I keep running into this issue which isn't great for my work .
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: 3 of these dremels all died within 9 months
customer_reviews.text: RIeally good while it works. I work in a grooming salon where we need dremels. Half our salon has dremels with battery packs, and the other half have this dremel. Mine and 2 other girls' same dremels died around 6-9 months. It would charge slow, then it would not hold a full charge, until it completely wouldnt turn on. Its a really good and fast dremel when it does charge...
customer_reviews.author: Melynda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grinding dogs nails.
customer_reviews.text: Use this for grinding dogs nails as a dog groomer. Default setting at 15k rpm is perfect for small dogs and 20k rpm is great for large dogs. The higher setting I haven’t used but I think it would scare dogs too much and is maybe too fast for use on a dog anyway. Great dremel and I love that it has a charger rather than a battery change feature.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Wakefield

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to control, effective speed control.
customer_reviews.text: Using this to shorten overgrown dog nails, it has been the best option. Dogs have to get used to the sound, and you have to drop the rpm's down to keep it from sounding like a jetliner at takeoff, but an mid-speed it still takes nails down smoothly and rapidly. Works great on zombie toenails, too. Older readers will know what I mean. Stub your toe just right, and it alters growth to a thick armor plate.
customer_reviews.author: John Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 4 months, but now won't charge. Notice the metal contacts on bottom of tool had come off which is most likely the problem. Call customer support and was to to call back in one month due to pandemic. Poor quality compared to my 20 year old corded dremel.
customer_reviews.author: 53 Buckeye

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tool!!
customer_reviews.text: This dremel is wonderful!! I was leery of the rechargeable unit as my other one is electric but this one out performs the old one. Of course they have a multitude of uses and that makes me recommend them even more! Great for crafts and building small items as well as many other uses. This one is easier to handle and write with than others I have. Just easier to hold & manipulate. So of course we recommend and would repurchase if we needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs B

customer_reviews.title: Just ok....
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this Dremel....Using it on a mosaic project and the first day it was great. Charged up perfectly....then...the second charge.....It won't stay in contact with the charger so I have to constantly monitor it and jiggle it around until it lights up again.....
customer_reviews.author: Angela M. Dioca

customer_reviews.title: Perfect groomers tool
customer_reviews.text: I love it! To all groomers this dremel is thin, light, quiet, 5 speeds! Has a light, seriously I can’t believe I’m this excited over a dremel. Double what I usually spend but so worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Cox

customer_reviews.title: not working after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This was my 2nd purchase of this product. The first lasted many years, but this one has quit after only 5 months. I can put it on the charger, the lights flash for a second and go out. I don't know if it's the charger or the battery in the unit but it is no longer working. (I use it to grind nails of my 4 dogs - is not overused.)
customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I had this exactly 3 months and 2 days before it broke. It started to sound loud and vibrating hard and then stopped...the charger lights react but it no longer turns on.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gulo

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tool. It was worth every penny. My only complaint is a design issue. It seems really silly to put the lock button right next to the power button. I suspect this will be how I eventually break my tool by pressing the lock button while it is on at a high speed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sega

customer_reviews.title: heats up!!!!  Unnecessary vet bill that was my stupidity for using this!
customer_reviews.text: after using it twice, it HEATS UP and I burned my dog with it. My husband warned me but I didn’t listen. Wish I would have sent it back before I burned my dog and had to go to the vet!!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use though had to ask hubby how to ...
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far. Watching for charging issues but none so far. Easy to use though had to ask hubby how to put the sanding band attachment on lol. I can see why so many state it doesn't come with the correct attachment. It does. Instruction booklet expects you to know how to adjust the dremel bit (wider) to fit the attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Selhaverramos

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for Christmas for my daughter in law. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas for my daughter in law. She is a professional wedding cake baker. She uses it to cut out cake bottoms and the wooden dowels that go up the center of large tier cakes.She is now exploring other forms for cakes as she now has all the other attachments. Previously she used her husband's Dremel which entailed, finding it, cleaning it, sterilizing the blade or bits etc. She is thrilled with her own Dremel tool now and she loves it. She just has to hide it from her husband because he has an older one. I told him I'd buy him a new one for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: ED F.

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Dead out of the box. Would not charge, would not power on. After reading other reviews that this item fails to charge after a short period I lost confidence and decided to return it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best Dremel hands down
customer_reviews.text: I am a dog groomer and use this mainly for doing dog nails. Before being a dog groomer I use to make proto types and have use many Dremels. This Dremel is hands down the best. I never thought the light would be help full but it is amazing. You are able to turn the light off if needed. Holds a charge and is durable. I have dropped it on concrete floors many times and no problems. It is also nice, light weight and still has the power to do what you need it to do
customer_reviews.author: William Green

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dog nails, but not great for anything else
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do my dogs nails, and it works great! But we tried it for a couple different projects and it didn't work at all. It doesn't have the force or the battery power to cut through the thinnest MDF board. So that was a little disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Madi K

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly powerful and light
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for Medium to Heavy usage for short periods (5min at a time). I probably wouldn’t want to run it for 10min straight under a heavy load, but it’s great for what I’m needing. Lightweight too. It’s a little janky sounding at full speed, but if you hold it properly it’s not too loud. Would like the option to turn of the LED, but it’s a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Approved by Bob the Parakeet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dremel for trimming parrot toe nails, and it works like a charm. It's very quiet so that it doesn't scare them. The light is very useful to help you see the nail quick and avoid going too short. If you get this for your birds, let them see it in your hand and let them get used to the sound and the light before trying to use it. I let them see that it was nothing to be afraid of for a week or two, and then I was able to use it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Nail Trimmer Around
customer_reviews.text: Forget those low power "specialty" nail trimmers you have seen out there, this is the best way to trim your dog's nails. The light makes it to easy to see no matter what the conditions. It's pretty quiet and the speed is adjustable. I am sure it would work great just as a Dremel also but we use it to trim nails and LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Love it but won’t charge anymore
customer_reviews.text: The thing only lasted a couple months and then it stopped taking charge. I really like it but it’s too expensive to only last that long. Previous review: Great tool, I use to Dremel dogs nails and it will get REALLY quieter for dogs that can be afraid and also can get a lot of speed for quick work
customer_reviews.author: kayla c.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage - One use and the Dremel 8050 is dead
customer_reviews.text: I completed a single 5 minute project with this device, set it in the charger and went back to use it 3 days later for a second project. According the manual, the device should be smart enough not to overcharge the 8050. Went to use it on project #2 and it was completely dead. Nothing happens at all when pressing the power button. Placing the Dremel in the dock causes a few of the "speed indicator" lights to flash, but they don't scroll like the the charging pattern and I get no battery level indicator. ONE USE ... DEAD ... I guess they literally don't make them like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stoakley

customer_reviews.title: Right tool for the right job....
customer_reviews.text: Saw a bunch of negative reviews about the battery and durability of the motor. I feel like it is plenty durable as long as you are not trying to utilize the tool for a project that really requires a larger tool for the job. As long as you use the dremel for jobs that it is meant to be used for it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: M.Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for cutting nails.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to grind the toenails on my Vizsla dog. It does a good job, and is not as noisy as the corded models I tried to use in the past. Also, the light is fantastic for working on his nails anywhere - I don't need to work under a bright lamp or in the sun. Battery life has been great.
customer_reviews.author: TerryB

customer_reviews.title: Can’t use it on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Kit unusable at arrival because it does not come with collet nuts that fit the various tools. Until you order the other collet nuts you can’t use any of the tools.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Bob Cash

customer_reviews.title: Works well on dog's nails.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to dremel my dog's nails after I clip them. Speed settings are nice, and holds a charge pretty well. Haven't used it for any other purpose, so I'm only attesting to using it on dog nails.
customer_reviews.author: RC S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for doing dog toe nails
customer_reviews.text: Love this Dremel. It is light and the adjustable speeds are great. I use it for trimming my dogs' toe nails. Both prefer it to the older model that I had been using since I can adjust the speed and keep it running quieter. It has more power than my old one too so it does a better job. The lithium ion battery is really nice since it holds the charge so well and it can be left on the charger without messing up the battery memory.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Muntz

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this January 29 2020 to grind toenails in my grooming shop. It was not used hard just Average use. It is July 7th and it died this morning. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A gift for the hubby...
customer_reviews.text: Hubby thinks this is great! He uses it mainly to trim our 2 large dogs' toenails, but put a Dremel tool in a guy's hand and he's suddenly motivated! Getting lots of things done out in the garage...(!!) Very nice tool. Fits comfortably in the hand, charges rapidly, quiet enough that the dogs snooze while he is grinding away on their nails. Happy hubby=happy wife=happy life. Great gift idea for any guy!!
customer_reviews.author: Patty A

customer_reviews.title: Great cordless tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love my cordless Dremel! I use it to etch glass. Love the versatility of the cordless! I take it with me to craft shows to personalize items on the spot! However, I do prefer my corded Dremel tool if you are trying to decide between the two. But, for the versatility of the cities to use anywhere, it is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Sape

product_meta.title: Dremel 8050-N/18 Micro Cordless Rotary Tool Kit with Docking Station- Engraver, Polisher, and Detail Sander- Ideal for Glass Engraving, Wood Carving, Sanding, Polishing, and Cutting- 18 Accessories
product_meta.description: Style:Rotary toolWith surprising power that lets you cut metal with ease, the Dremel Micro is the perfect combination of size, ergonomics and power that make it the ultimate tool for both precise and light duty DIY tasks. Designed to be held between the thumb and forefinger like a pencil, the Dremel Micro allows a grip that is close to the work-piece for superior maneuverability and control. The Dremel Micro is powered by an integrated high capacity 8V lithium-ion battery for longer run time with no memory effect. Optimal speed control on the Dremel Micro is especially user-friendly. The speed is adjusted in five stages from 5,000 to 25,000 rpm by using two buttons on the top of the tool, which enables it to be adapted to each application. A five-stage LED scale makes it quick and easy to see which speed is currently set. To illuminate projects, the Dremel Micro has LED lights built uniquely into the nose cap to aid in vision and accuracy. The brilliantly powerful Dremel Micro features lights that indicate battery level, lithium ion battery technology, and a docking station that automatically stops charging when the batteries have reached capacity. Material: High density plastic.
feature_bullets: Brilliantly powerful – Cordless rotary tool with LED light offers the perfect combination of size, ergonomics, and power for precise and light-duty DIY projects.
LED Project light - Front end light illuminates projects for better visibility.
High capacity rechargeable battery – 8 Volt Lithium-Ion battery delivers compact power and longer run times. Always ready and no memory effects.
Docking station – Continually charges the tool so it always fully charged and ready to use. LED Battery life Indicator lets you know when it’s ready for a recharge. 3 hour & 45 minute charge time.
Variable speed with LED dial – Achieve your optimal speed between 5,000 – 25,000 RPM using the LED speed dial indicator
Versatile tool kit – Includes 8050 cordless rotary tool, 18 high-quality Dremel accessories, and a charging dock.
Slim & ergonomic body - for added comfort & grip during extended use
2 year warranty & USA-based customer service – available by chat, email, phone or visit us at our service center in racine, WI

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,169 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
